author: mani mejia
title: Voluntary.Gold: a community network
description: Worldwide cardano community lacks a decentralized platform for collaboration, leadership development, social interaction, & incentivisation.

assessments.note:
I really like the idea of bringing do-gooders together in one place, connecting our community with other change-maker communities, bringing organizations and businesses in and incentivizing the whole thing with a native Cardano token. I also like the focus on leadership / teamwork / facilitation.

The rest of it... still needs work. Not too stoked about the name... and ,frankly: the website needs to be done properly.

While this proposal is well thought out, it doesn't address this challenge's goal of increasing the effectiveness of distributed decision making. The proposal doesn't demonstrate how it will make an improvement in community confidence or engagement in distributed decisions.

All of the objectives of social collaboration can be reached using existing collaboration platforms like Trello, Asana, Jira and many more. There is no need for the community to fund a small part of what will be needed to create a new platform
The proposal aims at creating a platform to facilitate learning and co-working.
This is a huge undertaking and the team needs many new faces to be anywhere near complete.
The proposal is stacked with talent and a clear set of goals that have been well thought out.
Seems like a decent group of talent. But their objective is far beyond the range of funding they can expect to get from the Cardano Community. Especially to re-invent the wheel.

The proposal is asking for the full value of the fund, so it should be expected that they solve the totality of the challenge alone, without other proposals. I don't think that their solution is all encompassing and I don't think that, in the next two rounds, it will make a big difference for Cardano. There are no clearly unambiguously stated auditable goals.
Proper budget and clear metrics are needed.
The proposal fails to demonstrate a measure for success against the goal of increasing participation and confidence in distributed decision making.
YEs the proposal does provide enough information to assess the feasibility/

Again, the plan is too general, I would like to see detailed breakdown of goals, costs and a timeline we can follow. Proposer is asking for the full value of the fund, so the standard needs to be very high.

solution: Our federated network is being built for community members to self organize, train and support each other, and be rewarded for their service
experience: Our team of 3 has 31y in web technology; 56y in volunteer mgmt; 25y in entrepreneurship; 3y in crypto; a PhD in Org Leadership; plus you too
